product_name: IT CosmeticsConfidence in Your Beauty Sleep Night Cream
summary: SummaryIT Cosmetics Confidence in Your Beauty Sleep Night Cream works overnight to visibly improve the 5 top signs of aging skin: fine lines, wrinkles, dryness, dullness and loss of firmness.
details: DetailsFeaturesConfidence in Your Beauty Sleep Night Cream helps you wake up to more beautiful, younger-looking skin!This moisturizer works overnight - when your skin cell turnover peaks - to improve surface cell renewal through exfoliation.Featuring Rest & Restore Technology, it visibly improves 5 of the top signs of aging skin: fine lines, wrinkles, dryness, dullness and loss of firmness.After just 1 sleep, your skin will feel hydrated, smooth and supple. And after 7 sleeps, your fine lines will diminish in appearance and your skin will feel firmer and look plumper!Suitable for all skin types and made with skin-loving ceramides and hyaluronic acid, Confidence in Your Beauty Sleep's unique texture, called MemoryBounce Technology, is rich and enveloping for luxurious application experience.With a soothing lavender scent, this luxurious night cream makes the perfect last step in your skincare routine!IT Cosmetics partners with plastic surgeons and dermatologists to develop skin-loving solutions and clinically tested formulas.BenefitsProprietary Rest & Restore Technology works to visibly improve five of the top signs of aging skin in just 7 sleeps!The formula's texture also prevents visible product transfer on your pillow.Non-comedogenic, hydrating formula is suitable for all skin types and infused with hyaluronic acid and adenosine, plus ceramides to help repair and restore the natural skin barrier.Research ResultsIn 7 sleeps visibly improves 5 top signs on aging skin:Fine LinesDrynessLoss of FirmnessDullnessTired-looking SkinItem 2557701How To UseEvery night, apply generously onto face using upward sweeping motions. Do not rinse.Beauty Tip: Make Confidence in Your Beauty Sleep Night Cream your last skincare step before going to bed! This transforming moisturizer locks in any previously applied skincare, ensuring throughout the night that your skincare stays on your face - not your pillow!IngredientsAqua/Water/Eau, Dimethicone, Glycerin, Simmondsia Chinensis Seed Oil/Jojoba Seed Oil, Hydrogenated Castor Oil Dimer Dilinoleate, Propanediol, Alcohol Denat., Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Cetyl Alcohol, Cetyl Hydroxyethylcellulose, Octyldodecanol, Silica, Phenoxyethanol, Albizia Julibrissin Bark Extract, Caprylyl Glycol, Parfum/Fragrance, Poloxamer 338, Capryloyl Salicylic Acid, Limonene, Adenosine, Tocopherol, Xanthan Gum, Disodium Edta, Linalool, Ceramide Np, Hydroxypalmitoyl Sphinganine, Silica Dimethyl Silylate, Hydrated Silica, Sodium Hyaluronate, Polysorbate 60, Citronellol, Sodium Benzoate, CI 16035/Red 40, Geraniol, Cereus Grandiflorus Flower Extract/Cactus Flower Extract, Citral, Darutoside, CI 42090/Blue 1, Glucose, Lactic Acid, Potassium Sorbate.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Every night, apply generously onto face using upward sweeping motions. Do not rinse.Beauty Tip: Make Confidence in Your Beauty Sleep Night Cream your last skincare step before going to bed! This transforming moisturizer locks in any previously applied skincare, ensuring throughout the night that your skincare stays on your face - not your pillow!
ingredients: Simmondsia Chinensis Seed Oil/Jojoba Seed Oil
Cereus Grandiflorus Flower Extract/Cactus Flower Extract

reviews.headline: Great night cream
reviews.comments: I've been using Confidence in Your Beauty Sleep Night Cream for over a year.  I love the smell, the way it feels on my skin and the way my skin looks and feels when I wake up in the morning. I'm normally very sensitive to fragrances, but I love the light spa like smell of this night cream. It smells so nice going on and doesn't linger on my skin throughout the night.

reviews.headline: Excellent
reviews.comments: Really love this! Will be buying the full size!

reviews.headline: Lightweight night cream
reviews.comments: Purchased based on recommendation from sales person. Needed a good night cream. Like the way it feels and smells. A little goes a long way. However, I'm still determining whether it clogs my pores. I had a few and believe it may be because of this cream.

reviews.headline: It's greasy and it smells terrible
reviews.comments: I can't believe all the great reviews this stuff has. I'm 53 with combination oily skin. This stuff is greasy and smells like medicine. Not at all what I want on my skin at bedtime.

reviews.headline: Pleasantly surprised!!
reviews.comments: I bought this cream on sale a little while ago and I must say I'm very pleased with it! I have pretty dry skin so I find many night creams don't last through the night and I still wake up feeling dry. With this one though, I wake up feeling well moisturized! The lavender scent is a nice touch too.

reviews.headline: I love this product the it cosmetics blue night cream.
reviews.comments: Have been using this product for over 3 years it tightens skin around face and jaw line. Good on all skin problems. My skin is smooth.

reviews.headline: Best nighttime moisturizer 40+
reviews.comments:
I am over 40 and live in a very dry & hot climate, this moisturizer is actual magic. I am on my 3rd jar and it is expensive so I am always trying to hunt for it on sale, it is worth it. 
Very moisturizing and sinks deep into your skin. It doesn't play will with other skin care products but that's because it takes time to sink in. I use this every night before bed and my skin feels pillow soft in the morning. Too heavy for any daytime use but a must have for nighttime skin care.

reviews.headline: Sensitive skin
reviews.comments: I have super sensitive skin and so far this has not broke me out or caused a reaction. Nice texture. It does have a little bit of a scent and a menthol cooling feel to it at first but I do see a difference in my skin. I would recommend

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: Got a small sample of this product which led to me buying one and it works amazing.

reviews.headline: A no go
reviews.comments: Love the daily moisturizer from this brand nd decided to try this oneâ€¦ it burns idk if its because of the scent but something about it burns my face. But does feel very thick and creamy which is the only thing I liked. I wont be buying it again.

reviews.headline: Not for sensitive skin
reviews.comments: I love this brand so much that i wanted to try this night cream. I applied it sparingly every night for about a month, and unfortunately it made me break out so bad that i had acne scars from it. Im very disappointed in this product. It's definitely not for sensitive oily skin.

reviews.headline: Amazing night moisturizer!
reviews.comments: I have super sensitive skin and I also have rosacea. I received a tiny sample jar of this from an online purchase and after trying it out for about a week now, I am now obsessed with this stuff! It doesn't just feel amazing, it smells amazing. I also have not had any breakouts so far Knock on wood) which is something that most moisturizers do on my skin. I also love how cooling it feels going onto the skin. I'm not sure about these reviews that talk about it burning their skinâ€¦maybe they are allergic to lavender? For my super sensitive skin, this stuff has been great! I've not used it long enough to see any real results from it, but I will say that my skin does feel pretty amazing after a week of use.

reviews.headline: Reviews were tight.
reviews.comments: Received a free sample- reviews were right. After about 10 minutes my face started burning. I washed it off & my skin is still hurting.

reviews.headline: Enjoyed using this product
reviews.comments: I received a free sample of this product and immediately knew that i wanted to purchase the full size product. I love the scent, texture and soothing feel of this cream.

reviews.headline: Burns Like Hot Sauce but does moisturize
reviews.comments: The daytime lotion worked great for me somi got this thinking it might just be a bit richer, its more gummy/mousy in texture and burns like crazy. My face never turned red or broke out and i woke moisturized but it burns around my nose and mouth for a solid hour after putting it on and eventually dies down. Because this is so expensive and it visually worked great, I'm toughing through it to use up the tub but will not be repurchasing.

reviews.headline: Arden Night Cream Dupe
reviews.comments: If you loved Elizabeth Arden's discontinued night cream, look no further! This is your dupe. Smell is identical and the texture is exactly the same.

reviews.headline: Never again
reviews.comments: I bought this with high expectations and am sad to report that I am extremely let down. Upon application my skin immediately started burning. My face is so red and raw feeling right now. I really wish I had a better experience but this has forced me to throw it away.

reviews.headline: Was Not A Fan
reviews.comments: This felt ok going in and it did moisturize, but it smells awful. It smells like burning lavender. I wanted to love this but just couldn't.

reviews.headline: Horrible product
reviews.comments: This stuff dried my eye area so badly i to get prescription cream for them, Ive never been so unhappy with a face cream

reviews.headline: Pros & Cons
reviews.comments:
I have almost finished a jar of this night cream and feel confident enough to finally leave a review!

Pros:
- Lovely gel consistency that is almost cooling to the skin. Locks in moisture overnight, my skin always felt hydrated in the morning. 
- Works well with other products. I have used with an eye cream and sometimes over a layer of hyaluronic acid serum for extra hydration and have never had any pilling or weird reactions. 
- Lavendar scent is light and pleasant. Strongest when first applying then fades away. 

Cons:
- Expensive! Lasts a long time but there are more economical options out there. 
- Irritates dry eyes. I noticed I would have some tearing and burning after removing my contact lenses and then applying this product on days my eyes were dry. I attribute this to the lavendar scent since similar frangrace free products did not have the same effects. Not a deal breaker but something to be aware of. 
- Didn't always want the lavender scent. It was nice, but personally I got tired of it and more often than not wished it was fragrance free.

media.caption:
ï»¿
ï»¿It Confidence In Your Beauty Sleep - Skin Transforming Pillow Cream is great to use as the last step in your night time skincare routine. It improves fine lines, dry, dull skin, loss of firmness and tired looking skin. .

It's Proprietary Rest & Restore Technology works overnight when your skin cell turnover peaks. It's made with ceramides to help repair and restore the natural skin barrier and Infused with a soothing lavender scent.
.

This is a thicker moisturizer and does leave a tacky feel to your skin. I use it before bed and when I wake up my skin feels soft, but greasy. My skin looks less dull and more vibrant. I really love the lavender scent it's perfect for bed time. .

faceoff_positive.comments: I have sensitive skin and don't wear night creams because they all seem to make me breakout. I am in love with this night cream! It's moisturizing for my combination skin without being too heavy. It doesn't make me break out like other nite dreams and it smells wonderful! The lavender smell is subtle hit just enough to help me sleep better too. I am hooked to this stuff! Please don't discontinue it! My skin has never looked better.
faceoff_positive.headline: Perfect for combination skin!

faceoff_negative.comments:
I loved the Confidence in a Cream so I wanted to give this moisturizer a try. It seemed to get pretty great reviews, so I looked forward to trying it. Well, even after the first application I was very disappointed. While the lavender smell doesn't bother me, the consistency of the product, and how it applied were awful. Per someone else's experience/review from 6 months ago, I ran into the same issue of the product becoming rather waxy and rolled up into little sticky splodges when I was simply trying to massage the product into my face. Not only that, but those little gluey blobs ended up coming off onto my pillow case (pictured), the product just wouldn't absorb into my skin. 
The consistency of the product was also odd, compared to the Confidence in a Cream moisturizer, which I thought was strange. Along with that, I felt that even after giving it a second try, it started to really irritate my skin, so I simply ended up throwing the product out. I'll be sticking with Confidence in Cream from here on out...
faceoff_negative.headline: Biggest Regret/Waste of $
